snippet: President Obama’s new mortgage refinancing plan could provide considerable relief for millions of homeowners shackled to high interest rates, if Congress approves it.
abstract: Editorial asserts that Pres Obama's new mortgage refinancing plan, although unlikely to be passed by Congress, could provide considerable relief for millions of homeowners shackled to high interest rates; argues that it demonstrates a clear contrast with Republican plans.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s new mortgage refinancing plan could provide considerable relief for millions of homeowners shackled to high interest rates, if Congress approves it.
